Okay, I feel really stupid, but I joined because I wanted to read/post fanf=
iction about the Shinsengumi. I saw something on the main page about busine=
ss lists and files, and here again you mention group files, but I can't fin=
d anything that says "files" or "fanfic" or "fiction folder" or anything of=
 the kind. While it's entirely possible that I'm a) retarded or b) blind, I=
 find it very frustrating that this isn't more obvious when that's supposed=
 to be the major reason for the group. Or so the listing on Shinsengumi HQ =
said. Help?

Thanks,
Pen

can you send any fanfiction. i made a few and i want people to read

> Your story ha=
s to contain at least one Shinsengumi character but ti can
> be from any "u=
niverse" Kenshin Peace Maker Kurogane, the NHK Taiga
> drama, historical, f=
ilms etc.

> Here are the guidelines as they appear in the group fi=
les section
> 
> 
> 
>   *Submitting Fiction*
> 
>  
> 
> Stories and poetr=
y can be posted to the list or uploaded into the 
> Fiction folder under Fi=
les, or both.  When you post to the list, 
> formatting will usually be los=
t.  Saving your story or poem as an html 
> document enables you to format =
a story the way you want and have it be 
> seen that way. Just keep readabi=
lity in mind when you get enthusiastic 
> with color and fonts.  J  (In MSW=
ord, to save a document in html format, 
> you can either choose the "Save =
as" feature under File and choose "web 
> page" in the drop down menu OR ag=
ain under File, click on "Save as web 
> document."  Those of us accustomed=
 to uploading stories on ff.net should 
> be aware that uploading to the ya=
hoo list site keeps formatting exactly 
> as you save it, unlike ff.net whi=
ch puts lines in after returns.  It's 
> been ages since I've worked with W=
ordPerfect, so I don't know how it 
> works, but I imagine it's similar.  S=
end a query to the list for help if 
> you need to.)
> 
>  
> 
> If the sto=
ry or poem is being posted to the list, in the subject line, 
> please prov=
ide the following FIC: <title>, <source material>, <character 
> or pairing=
>, <rating>
> 
>  
> 
> As an example, using one of my Rurouni Kenshin stor=
ies:  FIC: Kitaku, 
> RK, SaitouxSano, R
> 
>  
> 
> You can use semi-colon=
s to separate the information or put non-title 
> information within parent=
heses, etc., but include the information so 
> others can see at a glance i=
f it is something they're interested in.  
> With so much potential diversi=
ty of characters, situations, and source 
> materials, it's only common cou=
rtesy.
> 
>  
> 
> Please include the following header when posting a story=
 to the list or 
> uploading it to the File folder.  I know it's a pain, bu=
t it allows 
> readers the choice of what they want to read and what they w=
ant to 
> avoid, as well as quick access to author information, permission =
to 
> archive on the website, and a disclaimer to protect yourself.  Storie=
s 
> that are posted without the header will be deleted.  Forgetfulness 
> =
happens --- don't take it personally.  Just repost it with the header.  
> =
(Or just send a message that, ACK! you forgot the header and correct it 
> =
on the upload in Files.) If the story contains multiple parts or 
> chapter=
s, you can either repost the header each time or at the very 
> least repos=
t the disclaimer.  If information should change (such as the 
> story has s=
uddenly jumped from PG to R), please repost a new header when 
> you realiz=
e information in the original header has changed.  If you have 
> any quest=
ions, feel free to contact me, spiritus_saitou@...

ou@...> .
